description:
Learning outcomes be able to:

•Show how “business drivers” and ROI links to quality customer service

•Indicate how some perceptions of “challengingcustomers” are a result of poor companyprocesses, procedures as well as communication

•Listsome of the barriers to good communication caused by both parties

•Discuss the role customer service representativesplay to help or hinder a good conversation

•Discuss the FOCUS steps that can be used in handling telephone calls and F2F conversations

•Explain the difference between listening and hearing

•Use the listening steps to provide a win-win outcome

•Identify and work with “challenging customer” typesand explore the Dos, Don'ts and “how to”thatturns these Challenges into Wins

•Identify other behaviour types that can cause difficulties and discussways to deal with them

•Review a good Quality Assurance checklist that can be used to gain “continuous improvement” in customer service calls

The 9 module course content:

1.Customer Service as part of the big picture – impact on the business, internal and external customers

2.Perceptions, how to read people and situations quickly to lessen conflict, save time and add value to the communication

3. Identify barriers to communication that can be created by either party to the communication and how these obstacles can be minimised and overcome

4.Analyse 5 different customer service experiences – shared by people who have experienced them to identify “where it all went wrong”

5.Use a 5step process that greatly assists achievinggoal orientated results and can be used to identify strengths and areas for development in the customer call

6.Use the pyramid tool to link to a Quality Assurance checklist that encourages “continuous improvement”

7.Learn the Matrix on dealing with challenging customers that has been invaluable to CSR working in very demanding roles in customer service.

8.Encourage communicate and behaviours to get a good outcome.Control the call without“being controlling”
title: Customer Service and Dealing with Challenging Customers
